routes.name: Audit Trail
routes.description: The Audit page provides a complete trail of all changes made across your PPM workspace. Track who modified projects, schedules, budgets, or risks, with timestamps and before/after values. Use it for compliance requirements, debugging issues, or understanding decision-making history. Filter by user, date range, or entity type to quickly find relevant changes. Export audit logs for external reporting. This helps PPM teams maintain transparency and accountability in portfolio decisions.

routes.name: Budget Tracking
routes.description: Budget Tracking helps you monitor planned vs actual spending across your project portfolio. Set baseline budgets, track commitments and expenditures, and view variance reports. Get alerts for over-budget projects and drill down into cost categories like labor, materials, or vendors. Use it during quarterly reviews to justify funding requests or reallocate resources. Real-time dashboards show portfolio-level budget health, helping PMOs maintain financial discipline.

routes.name: Changes
routes.description: Changes tracks all change requests, scope modifications, and approval workflows across your projects. Submit new change requests with impact assessments on schedule, cost, and risk. Review pending changes in a centralized queue with automated routing to approvers. Track change history and analyze trends to improve change management processes. Use it to maintain control over scope creep while ensuring legitimate changes are processed efficiently in your PPM environment.

routes.name: Costbook
routes.description: The Costbook is your centralized library of cost rates, resources, and pricing templates. Define hourly rates for team members, contractors, and equipment, then apply them consistently across projects. Create cost templates for common work packages to speed up planning. Use it to ensure accurate financial forecasting and standardize costing methodology across your PPM workflows. Perfect for organizations needing defensible cost models for stakeholder reviews.

routes.name: Dashboards
routes.description: Dashboards let you create personalized views of your PPM data with drag-and-drop widgets. Monitor portfolio health through KPIs like schedule variance, budget status, and resource utilization. Build executive dashboards with traffic light indicators and drill-down capabilities. Save multiple dashboard layouts for different stakeholdersâ€”from project managers to C-suite executives. Use it daily to get instant visibility into portfolio performance and spot issues before they escalate.

routes.name: EAC Calculations
routes.description: EAC (Estimate at Completion) Calculation forecasts final project costs based on current performance. Choose from methods like Bottom-Up, Top-Down, or Earned Value formulas. Input actuals to date, remaining work estimates, and performance indices for accurate predictions. Compare EAC against original budgets to identify at-risk projects early. Use during monthly portfolio reviews to communicate realistic completion costs to executives and adjust resource allocations proactively.

routes.name: Feedback & Support
routes.description: Feedback captures user suggestions, bug reports, and feature requests directly within Orka PPM. Submit detailed feedback with screenshots and affected project context. Vote on existing feedback to prioritize improvements. Track resolution status and see how your input shapes the product roadmap. Use it to help make Orka PPM work better for your specific PPM workflows and team needs.

routes.name: Financial Forecasts
routes.description: Financial Forecast provides rolling 12-18 month cash flow projections across your entire portfolio. Aggregate project forecasts, factoring in planned spending, revenue milestones, and contingency reserves. Scenario planning lets you test 'what-if' impacts of delays or scope changes. Use it for executive cash flow reporting and capital planning. Interactive charts show monthly burn rates and cumulative spend, helping PPM leaders align projects with corporate financial goals.

routes.name: Financials
routes.description: The Financials hub gives you a 360Â° view of portfolio financial health through configurable tabs. Switch between Budget Tracking, Costbook, EAC calculations, and forecasting tools. Create custom dashboards showing KPIs like cost variance, ROI projections, and funding utilization. Use it as your primary financial command center for portfolio analysis and decision-making. Perfect for PMOs needing to answer executive questions about project spending and financial performance instantly.

routes.name: Import
routes.description: Import provides bulk data loading for projects, resources, schedules, and financials from CSV, Excel, or external systems. Map columns to Orka fields with preview validation before committing. Schedule recurring imports for ongoing data synchronization. Use it during initial PPM implementation or monthly actuals updates. Comprehensive error reporting and rollback capabilities ensure data integrity across your portfolio.

routes.name: Monte Carlo
routes.description: Monte Carlo simulation runs thousands of schedule and cost scenarios using probabilistic modeling. Define uncertainty ranges for task durations, costs, and dependencies. Get probability distributions for completion dates and total costs, not just single-point estimates. Use it for high-stakes projects where executives need confidence intervals (80% likely to complete by X date). Essential for portfolio-level risk analysis and contingency planning.

routes.name: PMR Reports
routes.description: PMR Reports (Project Management Review) deliver standardized executive portfolio summaries. Generate slide-ready reports showing health scores, milestone status, and financial summaries. Customize templates with your organization's KPIs and branding. Schedule automated distribution to stakeholders. Use monthly for Portfolio Management Review meetings to communicate portfolio status concisely to executives and governance boards.

routes.name: Project Import
routes.description: Project Import streamlines onboarding multiple projects from spreadsheets or legacy systems. Map project fields, phases, resources, and costs with data validation previews. Import hierarchical work breakdown structures and relationships between projects. Use it for PPM implementation, quarterly portfolio refresh, or merging acquired project data. Maintains data relationships and history while accelerating portfolio setup.

routes.name: Projects
routes.description: Projects is the heart of Orka PPM, showing your complete project portfolio with health indicators. Filter and sort by status, owner, phase, or custom criteria. Drill into individual projects for detailed schedules, financials, and risks. Use portfolio-level actions to bulk update, prioritize, or reallocate resources across projects. Perfect for PMOs managing 10-1000+ projects needing portfolio visibility and governance.

routes.name: Reports
routes.description: Reports is your one-stop shop for 50+ pre-built PPM reports plus custom report builder. Access portfolio summaries, project health scorecards, resource capacity plans, and financial variance analysis. Export to PDF, Excel, or PowerPoint with your branding. Schedule automated delivery and create saved report sets for recurring business reviews. Use it to eliminate manual reporting and deliver professional insights to stakeholders instantly.

routes.name: Resources
routes.description: Resources manages your team's capacity, allocation, and forecasting across all projects. View utilization heatmaps, skill matrices, and availability calendars. Assign resources to projects with automated conflict detection. Forecast hiring needs based on portfolio demand. Use it for resource leveling, capacity planning, and answering 'Do we have bandwidth for this new project?' questions confidently.

routes.name: Risks
routes.description: Risks provides enterprise risk management across your portfolio. Register risks with probability/impact scoring, mitigation plans, and ownership assignment. View portfolio heat maps and risk-adjusted schedules. Automated escalation when risks materialize. Use it for quarterly risk reviews, executive reporting, and integrating risk considerations into portfolio prioritization and resource allocation.

routes.name: Scenarios
routes.description: Scenarios lets you test 'what-if' portfolio decisions without affecting live data. Create alternate resource plans, reprioritize projects, or simulate budget cuts. Compare scenarios side-by-side with quantitative scoring (NPV, ROI, strategic alignment). Present multiple options to executives with clear trade-off analysis. Essential for strategic portfolio planning and rebalancing during market shifts or organizational changes.

routes.name: Schedules
routes.description: Schedules provides portfolio-level visibility into all project timelines and dependencies. Use Critical Path analysis, resource leveling, and baseline comparisons. Visualize with Gantt charts, timeline views, or milestone trackers. Bulk update dates across projects and forecast completion probability. Perfect for PMOs needing to answer 'What's slipping and why?' across their entire portfolio.
